manipulators.description: iTerm2 if copyMode = 1; Home -> 0 (Move to start of line)
iTerm2 if copyMode = 1; End -> $ (Move to end of line)
iTerm2 if copyMode = 1; Home+Shift -> 0 (Select and Move to start of line)
iTerm2 if copyMode = 1; End+Shift -> $ (Select and Move to end of line)
iTerm2 if copyMode = 1; Esc -> Esc+Esc (Exit and Reset)
iTerm2 map cmd+d to select word in copy mode
Browser, Telegram, Bitwarden home/end -> start/end of row
Browser, Telegram, Bitwarden home/end -> start/end of row
Browser, Telegram, Bitwarden home/end+shift -> start/end select of row

rules.description2: Switch super+cmd/opt+shift+j/; -> opt/cmd+shift+arrow_keys. Issue: need to set arrow + cmd/cmd+shft... to work as opt/opt+shift to jump on words, because MacOS by defualt jump on words is different from Windows. This must be before 'Set jkl; to arrows', because it have to be triggered first.

rules.description: ðŸ”µ 1.2 Set jkl;  ðŸ‘‰ arrow_keys (optional = any)
ðŸ”µ 1.3 Set m,./  ðŸ‘‰ page_keys (optional = any)
rules.description2: HISTORY INFO ONLY ! Instead of simply mapping m,./ to page_keys, we must declare home/end functionality alone, to make it function properly. I.e. 'm' -> 'left + cmd' to go to start of a row etc. This due macOS functioning different then Windows. Also lcmd+rcmd+comma (also 'nm,./[]' ) -> not work because of hardware limitation, see N-key rollover https://karabiner-elements.pqrs.org/docs/help/troubleshooting/cannot-use-some-key-combination

rules.description: ðŸ”µ 3 Finder modification to work as Windows File Explorer

manipulators.description: Use Esc to finish renaming when onEdit=1 and set onEdit=0 p.s. escape is caps_lock
Use Return as Open by defalut (if not renaming file), when onEdit=0
Use Return to finish renaming when onEdit=1
Use F2 as Rename and set onEdit=1
Go to... cmd+l -> cmd+g and set onEdit=1
Use Backspace as Go to Enclosing Folder if onEdit=0
Use super+backspace -> cmd+backspace (del) to Move to Bin if onEdit=0
Paste cmd+v when cutMode=1 and set cutMode=0

rules.description: ðŸ”µ 4 Cmd+CapsLock to Ctrl+Tab; Escape to CapsLock; Cmd+Delete to Opt+Delete; Adjust volume/brightness;
ðŸ”µ 5 Dock items with right_command and duplicate with left_option

manipulators.description: Open dev tools in browser cmd+shift+i -> cmd+opt+i
Move back in history opt+left; super+h -> cmd+[
Move forward in history opt+right; super+' -> cmd+]
Disable Quit App and remap cmd+q -> ctrl+q
Disable native Hide App cmd+h -> ctrl+h
